title: Trevor Noah: Destruction of al-Baghdadi’s wall causes Trump trauma
text:
CLOSE The late-night comics take on Trump's interpretation of the raid the killed ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. Mike Thompson, Detroit Free Press

The comics skewer Trump's speech about the raid that killed ISIS leader al-Baghdadi in Best of Late Night

The bone spurs that prevented President Donald Trump from serving in the military certainly didn’t stop him from taking credit for one of the most daring military operations in recent memory: The killing of Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi in a special operations raid last weekend.

And as you might suspect, the late-night comedians had something to say about such a display of bravado from a reported Vietnam draft dodger.

Jimmy Kimmel starts us off with a creative mashup video comparing Trump's speech announcing the death of the terrorist leader to former President Barack Obama's 2011 speech following a raid that killed al-Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden. Trevor Noah ties Trump's response over the destruction of a wall during the raid to his immigration dreams, and Stephen Colbert wonders if Trump really ought to share the less-than-appetizing details of al-Baghdadi's death.

"Daily Show" host Trevor Noah attends the TIME 100 Gala on April 23, 2019 in New York City. (Photo: Noam Galai/Getty Images for TIME)

After you watch our favorite jokes from last night's late-night lineup, vote for yours in the poll below.

description: The late-night comics rib Trump for his statements about the special forces operation that killed ISIS leader al-Baghdadi in Best of Late Night
